question: 海
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it should use the kun'yomi reading. When learning the kanji, you didn't learn that reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you with this word: 

You visit the <vocabulary>sea</vocabulary>. Strangely, it asks you who is visiting. You're so full of yourself (even in front of the sea/ocean) that you reply: "<reading>um, me</reading>?" (<ja>うみ</ja>). Imagine yourself feeling this full of yourself.
